newsitem.title: USA: Strong storm hits North Sea on Wednesday - WSC.
newsitem.headline: Strong storm hits North Sea on Wednesday - WSC.

text.p: A powerful storm system will cause extremely high winds of 30-70 mph (48-104 kph) in the North Sea on Wednesday, private forecaster Weather Services Corp said.
The winds will be strongest in the south and in the English Channel. Extensive operational delays are expected, WSC added.
West winds of 20-40 mph (32-64 kph) are expected on Thursday with higher gusts in the south.
